newsitem.title: USA: Remedy sets operating profits target.
newsitem.headline: Remedy sets operating profits target.

text.p: Remedy Corp Chief Financial Officer George De Urioste said on Wednesday that the company's financial model targets operating profits of 22-24 percent after 1997.
De Urioste was speaking at a presentation at the Montgomergy Securities conference here.
De Urioste told analysts that operating profits were running at a rate of 26 percent in the first half of 1996.
Remedy, maker of customer support software, said on Tuesday that it expected to report third-quarter earnings per share of about $0.30, exceeding analysts' expectations.

The company announced a two-for-one stock split on Tuesday. It will take the form of a stock dividend entitling each shareholder of record on October 14 to receive two shares for every one share of common stock held. The stock split takes effect October 25. Shares of Remedy closed 8-1/2 higher on Wednesday at 87 on Nasdaq.
